TrustD

Book A Demo Playground

TrustD

Access management systems today tries to make things seem much more complex than it has to be to sell an aura of spooky security. We want to create a simple, no-nonsense tool which will radically simplify access management, while making access more secure.

Take Care Of:

  • Which person can access which system at what privilege
  • Which AI Agent can access which system at what privilege
  • Which AI Agent even has network access to which system
  • Which internal application has accessed another application/db/whatever else, and has network access
  • Figuring out Who (or what) has used a system at any given time

Don't:

  • Be confused about who's using what
  • Use multiple platforms to manage access
  • Go through each system you use to figure out audit
  • Think about (much less write custom code to) managing access and entitlements

TrustD Audit

TrustD Audit is a source available (License) access control governance solution that allows you to write central identity rulesets and audit for access events. You can:

  • Write rulesets in rego to define who has access to what using custom tags for resources.
  • Use TrustD Audit to figure out who uses what by querying based on the custom tags
  • Use TrustD Audit to get alerts programmatically when rules are broken
  • Have your CI/CD query TrustD Audit to figure out if a policy change will impact your access rules
  • Have more ideas? Let us know directly or on Discord!
Launch An Instance Want Us To Host?

TrustD Secure

Have your rulesets defined but don't want to write code to automate enforcement? TrustD Secure enforces your existing TrustD Audit rulesets by:

  • Creating and managing your access control policies in the end systems (IAM Roles on AWS, Users and Grants on MySql, etc.)
  • Automatically alerting you on Slack (or whatever else you use) when a ruleset change causes issues with existing access.
  • Actively blocking access at various levels (network via firewall or vpn rules, access via IAM, etc)
  • Have more ideas? Let us know directly or on Discord!

Our goal is to make it ridiculously easy for you to manage access, and access doesn't just stop at identity.
